name: Tangalooma Island Resort

reviews.title: No-cancellation policy says it all.
reviews.text: The only way that this place can achieve anything higher that 3 stars is from people who read the very bad tripadvisor reveiews and are not expecting much. They are then pleasantly surprised to find out that it isn't that bad and give it a higher rating than it deserves.

I am was not expecting much either, but the truth is that it is bad, but not that bad... and I was there during the worst possible time. I would have cancelled if I could after an oil spill closed most of the island and rain flooded the resort, but I was determined to make the most of it.
reviews.title: Really beautiful resort and location

reviews.text: And apart from that, there is a strict no refund policy that management enforces... and from their previous responses to tripadvisor reviews, I know better than to bang my head against the wall.
reviews.title: Was better than expected

reviews.text: Accomodation: Clean and basic, but no maid service is a bit on the tight side and the first indication of what to expect.
reviews.title: Rip Off! Rip Off! Rip Off!!!!!!

reviews.text: Food: Slightly expensive, eg $15 burger+chips, but good quality and large portions.
reviews.title: Epitome of a Tourist 'Trap'

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a "deluxe room" in the Kookaburo Lodge; the newest of the facilities. The room resembled a bad room at a Motel 6; bathroom being old and beaten up, furnished like a dorm room and in bad taste (anyone's taste.) The resort itself is not clean, not kept up and the inside eating areas are dark and dirty with tables not being cleared, food on the floors, etc. The public bathrooms weren't cleaned during the day and got worse and worse as the day went on. Prices are over the top and this would be understandable if the resort lived up to the prices. The staff is indifferent and the long waits at the reception area is the first clue as to what you are in for.
reviews.title: great dolphins, terrible resort

likes.liked: — The beautiful beach and the dolphins are a must if you can overlook the resort

reviews.title: Horrible, awful "resort", but the Island is lovely!
reviews.text: The dolphin experience is wonderful but as someone else said before, I think that a tent would would far better accommodation than the resort presents.
Janice Hermann
reviews.title: heaven an hour from brisbane

likes.liked: — The amount of outdoor activites you can do
likes.disliked: — The restaurants were very overpriced, and the food was below average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited Tangalooma Island Resort in October 2008.
reviews.title: Great Location Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The previous negative reviews about the place are true, it is run-down, staff are unfriendly and non-exsistent in some areas (i.e happy hour in the main bar on a Saturday night
reviews.title: Best Holiday Ever

reviews.text: I recently spent three miserable nights at this resort. Firstly, let me say the island is beautiful. The animals and sea-life are amazing as is the beach and water. The resort is another thing.
reviews.title: Resort from Hell

reviews.text: The property has a sign noting the 1982 refurbishment, and it seems they have not done a single thing since. It is like stepping back in the 80s. The rooms are tired, and the beds caused us back pain they were so hard. We could hear every word our neighbours spoke. Also, we had a baby (we booked a portable cot) and they gave us a room up stairs! Very difficult to manage with a stroller!
reviews.title: Dolphins Great Food Terrible

likes.disliked: — Price for an appartment without linen was alot, and it was a long way from the resort for little legs.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were the epitome of rude. They were obnoxious and uncaring. After my husband took a fall down our unsafe stairwell with our baby in his arms, I had to beg for first aid from them. They could not care less.
reviews.title: Disappointed about the resort just like everyone else, loved the island itself

likes.disliked: — Service, difficulty of organising was stressful, not like a holiday should be

reviews.text: We were there in a major storm and the entire resort flooded in the first half hour of rain. Fellow guests were slipping over everywhere and they tried to charge some of us for bandages for our sprained ankles! I almost left on the first day.
reviews.title: Worst place I have ever stayed!

reviews.text: The food is very poor and limited in options. A hamburger cost $17 and a hot-dog cost $13. It was outrageous.
reviews.title: Waste of Time.... save your money or go elsewhere!!

likes.liked: — It was on a gorgeous island- but so are thousands of other resorts!!

reviews.title: Terrible Tangalooma!!
reviews.text: The island has great potential but falls way short of being a decent tourist resort. The beach was dirty (plastic bottles etc), the room was poor (dirty carpets) and the staff were not very as friendly as you expect them to be in a beach resort. It almost seems like they are being forced to stay on the island beyond their will!!

reviews.title: Best.Holiday.Ever
reviews.text: The worst aspect however was the food. It was pricey, which you would expect from an island, but at the same time the food was realy really really bad!!

reviews.title: Excellent nature resort
reviews.text: i have breakfast pre-paid....probably the worst breakfast i have ever had. I only paid $99 including breakfast per night....and now i can why. Avoid this place if you can.

reviews.title: Don't expect a lot
reviews.text: Cannot figure out where the negitive reviews are coming from. This was our second time staying at the resort and although we booked for 2 weeks,we ended up staying for 3 we loved it so much. Went with 3 teenagers (19,16,13) and they all had a ball,even my 19 year old daughter who would rather be out with friends than hang out with us. Going there when it was nearing winter,obviously things were quieter and the weather was cooler..including a whole week of pouring rain which pretty much confined us to our house,but didnt bother us as the views were awesome from where we were staying and we knew what to expect. Its a comfortable,unprecocious place,where, yes, some parts are old but it fits in with it all. Its relaxing..you could wear you pjs down to the shop and no one would bat and eyelid. Its a safe place for kids too, ours were often out around the resort by themselves or going off for lunch if all us adults wanted to do was relax, doing there own thing without us worrying about whether they were safe or not.

reviews.title: If you want a bad holiday go to Tangalooma
reviews.text: *The staff were GREAT. Cannot fault them at all. From the people in reception to the activity staff members to the waiters to the tours desk to the welcoming commitee to the education center..everyone..was plesant. Didnt come across one rude one, everyone was out-of-the-way nice to us,especially with the kids. They loved having a joke around with the staff members who we got to know quite well in our time there and were well looked after by them.

description: Tangalooma Island Resort is surrounded by white sandy beaches, crystal clear waters and fringed by national park, presenting another world away right on Brisbane’s doorstep! The highlight of any stay is the opportunity to interact closely with nature. Each evening, a pod of wild bottlenose dolphins eagerly swim up to the beach where they are hand fed by our Dolphin Care Team and resort guests. Only 75 minutes from Brisbane, over 75 tours and activities.
